definition[0]: to get money from someone by deceiving them
example[0]: a businessman who swindled investors out of millions of pounds
definition[1]: a situation in which someone gets money by deceiving someone else
definition[2]: to get money from someone dishonestly by deceiving them
example[2]: He was convicted of charges that he swindled clients and partners out of Â£3.5 million.
example[3]: The scheme was designed to swindle more than $250 million from the bank.
note[1]: swindle something out of somebody/ swindle something from somebody
